返券黃牛.definition: "shopping coupon scalper", sb who sells unwanted or returned shopping coupons to others for a profit

返回.definition: to return to; to come (or go) back

返崗.definition: to resume one's former position (after being laid off); to return to work (after taking leave)

返工.definition: to do poorly done work over again; (Guangdong dialect) to go to work

返潮.definition: (of clothing, furniture, walls etc) to get damp (by absorbing moisture from the air or the ground)

返現.definition: (neologism c. 2009) to give a cashback reward to a consumer

返璞歸真.definition: to return to one's true self; to regain the natural state

返程.definition: return trip; to make a return trip; to return

返老還童.definition: to recover one's youthful vigor; to feel rejuvenated (idiom)

返航.definition: to return to the point of departure

返還.definition: restitution; return of something to its original owner; remittance

返鄉.definition: to return to one's home town

返銷糧.definition: grain bought by the state and resold to areas undergoing a grain shortage

返青.definition: (of plants) to turn green again; to revegetate

返點.definition: sales bonus; affiliate reward; rebate; commission
